data:
Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hey Myrcella, 

 

I looked around a bit, and ended up with a few options here around Corvallis.  The first one is out on 2nd street.  The link about it is here: https://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5778075713.html

 

After searching around on apartments.com, I was also able to find two more that fit inside your price range and are in Corvallis. 

http://www.apartments.com/coral-heights-salem-or/hcnhw03/

http://www.apartments.com/rockwood-park-apartments-salem-or/qqqcj8w/

Though they look all right, they do allow pets so that may be a deal breaker.  Hope you are able to find a place soon!

Thanks,



Charles

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Wednesday, October 12, 2016 2:04 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Housing... OMG!

 

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Thanks, Charles! I was home schooled and internet search is not my forte! :)

 

Myr

Sent: Wednesday, October 12, 2016 2:14 PM

Subject: RE:  Housing... OMG!

After searching around on apartments.com, I was also able to find two more that fit inside your price range and are in Corvallis. 

http://www.apartments.com/coral-heights-salem-or/hcnhw03/

http://www.apartments.com/rockwood-park-apartments-salem-or/qqqcj8w/

Though they look all right, they do allow pets so that may be a deal breaker.  Hope you are able to find a place soon!

Thanks,

Charles

Subject:  Housing... OMG!

 

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Hey,

Looks like it’ll be pretty wet and windy, so I’d leave the sunblock and bring a coat.  You can check it out for yourself here: https://weather.com/weather/tenday/l/Alsea+OR+USOR0007:1:US  Have a good weekend!



Charles

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Wednesday, October 12, 2016 2:15 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Weather?

 

 

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Thanks for checking. I’ll let everyone know. I hope to see you there, Charles!

 

Myr

Sent: Wednesday, October 12, 2016 2:17 PM
To: Baratheon, Myrcella <Myrcella.Baratheon@oregonstate.edu>
Subject: RE:  Weather?

Looks like it’ll be pretty wet and windy, so I’d leave the sunblock and bring a coat.  You can check it out for yourself here: https://weather.com/weather/tenday/l/Alsea+OR+USOR0007:1:US  Have a good weekend!

To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu <mailto:Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu> >

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Hello Charles,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Myrcella,

 

After looking around, I found a tasty looking ham skewer recipe here:
http://www.food.com/recipe/pineapple-ham-skewers-308074

It’d work all right for the gluten free people, but the vegetarians might put up a fit so I also found this recipe for stuffed mushrooms.  http://allrecipes.com/recipe/15184/mouth-watering-stuffed-mushrooms/?internalSource=staff%20pick&referringId=76&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%203

 

I’m not to partial to mushrooms, but it looks all right.

http://allrecipes.com/recipe/229454/artichoke-hearts-gratin/?internalSource=staff%20pick&referringId=76&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%208

This one looks the tastiest to me, and apparently only takes about 35 minutes to make.  This last on says it’s a huge hit, and all you need to get besides the ingredients is tortilla chips.  http://allrecipes.com/recipe/23929/marys-roasted-red-pepper-dip/?internalSource=staff%20pick&referringId=105&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%208

 

I hope it ends up going all right, have fun!

 

Charles

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Wednesday, October 12, 2016 2:18 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Awesome recipes

 

 

Hello Charles,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

These all sound yummy, Charles! Maybe I am just hungry now :) I think my sisters will be happy.

 

Myr

This last on says it’s a huge hit, and all you need to get besides the ingredients is tortilla chips.  http://allrecipes.com/recipe/23929/marys-roasted-red-pepper-dip/?internalSource=staff%20pick&referringId=105&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%208

Hello Charles,

 

Just a friendly reminder that I’ll need the following two books soon and you promised to help me buy them for a good price! :)

 

Please find them wherever you can, just make sure you will receive them by next week for classes. My budget is at most 200 dollars to get these two textbooks, but please please please try and find the best available prices.

 

Textbooks Needed:

Engineering Economic Analysis by Donald Newnan 12th edition IBSN: 978-0199339273

 

Robert Love, Linux Kernel Development 3/e, Addison-Wesley, 2010, ISBN: 978-1-672-32946-3

 

Email me back with where to buy them for the best price so they’ll arrive next week! I owe you lunch for this big help!

 

Thanks! :) :) :)

Myrcella

Myrcella,

 

I found them for pretty good prices.  If you would be fine with a digital copy, you can find them at these two links

http://www.nylxs.com/docs/textbooks/Linux.Kernel.Development.3rd.Edition.pdf

http://site.iugaza.edu.ps/nsawalhi/files/2014/01/Engineering-Economic-Analysis-9th.pdf

The engineering textbook link is for the 9th edition, so it may be a bit different then the 12th.

 

The engineering textbook can be found here:

http://www.betterwordsbooks.com/Engineering-Economic-Analysis-by-Donald-G-Newnan_p_578295.html for only 30.59 <http://www.betterwordsbooks.com/Engineering-Economic-Analysis-by-Donald-G-Newnan_p_578295.html%20for%20only%2030.59>  ,

though the site looks kinda iffy.  Another place I found for it was here: 

http://www.biblio.com/book/engineering-economic-analysis-newnan-donald-g/d/914573441?aid=frg&utm_source=google&utm_medium=product&utm_campaign=feed-details&gclid=CJGl8emb1s8CFYNpfgodR8wOgQ

Though it costs more. 

 

The linux kernel development is here: https://www.amazon.com/Linux-Kernel-Development-Robert-Love/dp/0672329468 where it can be rented for only 30.00 or bought new for 40.00.

 

Good luck! 

Charles

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Wednesday, October 12, 2016 2:27 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Textbook help reminder!

I like “low cost” books, Charles! Especially as I don’t know if the books are good or not. Thanks for your help. We will have an awesome lunch with all the savings! :)

 

Myr

Hi, Charles ,
 
Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 
 
I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 
 
What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.
 
Thank you so much! 

Melisandre

Melisandre;

 

I found three shows that you might like:

 

Marco Polo: Rated 8.1/10 on IMDB.  Only on Netflix

Better Call Saul: Rated 8.8/10 on IMDB

Black Sails: Rated 8.1/10 on IMDB.  On amazon prime

 

I hope that one of these works.  I really enjoy Black Sails myself.

 

Charles

 

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Wednesday, October 12, 2016 3:33 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Best TV Show to Watch

 

Hi, Charles ,

 

Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 

 

I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 

 

What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.

 

Thank you so much! 


Melisandre

Only on Amazon Prime? They're doing originals now?! Gah, I'll have to get Prime too, now. Thanks :P

Melisandre

	Thank you so much! 

	
	Melisandre

Hi there!
 
I need to buy a gift for a friend.
 
My friend loves the outdoors and the color pink.
She’s 22 years old and her birthday is in a week (7 days).
I will need something that will get here on time.
Nothing that will take too long to ship please.
 
I have 30 dollars to spend on my friend.
Please spend as close to that as you can.
 
Please email me the link(s) to the gift(s) you find and include how much they cost.
 
Thank you,
Melisandre

Hey Melisandre,

 

I found a few things that seem like they would fit your friend.  I found an eight pack of an “Insulated fire starter” for $14.97.  It’s really reliable, and I enjoy using them when camping.

https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00FS37RF0/ref=cm_gf_ss_d_d_p_aA_i17_b0_p0_mg_OUTDOOR_RECREATION_PRODUCT?th=1

I also found a carabiner hook for hang stuff anywhere in the woods.  It’s only $17.00. 

https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0160E41GS/ref=cm_gf_ss_d_d_p_aA_i17_b0_p0_mg_OUTDOOR_RECREATION_PRODUCT?th=1

I also found a wireless speaker in pink that is great for long hikes that costs 27.75.

https://www.amazon.com/JBL-Wireless-Ultra-Portable-Bluetooth-Connectivity/dp/B00HWAB3ES/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1476312670&sr=8-2&keywords=wireless+speaker+pink

Finally, I found a Kayak, though it may be out of your price range at $1083.75.

https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00LC8757K/ref=cm_gf_ss_d_d_p_aA_i17_b0_p0_mg_OUTDOOR_RECREATION_PRODUCT

 

I hope your gift search goes well,

 

Charles

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Wednesday, October 12, 2016 3:47 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Find a Gift for Someone

Melisandre

Definitely the kayak...converting the numbers in my bank account to brownie points.

Mel

Hi there,

 

I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.

 

Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.

 

Thanks for volunteering to check it out!

 

Davos

Davos,

 

I took a look and it seems like neither drug will interact with each other, so your friend should be fine.  As for stuff he should avoid, just follow what it says for each drug.  Grapefruit shouldn’t be eaten because of the valium.  I used this website to check to see if it was okay to take them both together: http://www.webmd.com/interaction-checker/

Other than that, he should be fine.  Good luck,

 

Charles

 

From: Stark, Davos 
Sent: Wednesday, October 12, 2016 4:13 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  check on medication

Hey Charles,

 

I’m glad I came to you with this. Please keep this conversation between us. It’ll be our little secret ;)

 

Davos

Hello Charles,

 

I know graduating is coming up soon for you. It would be good to do a preliminary job search. Please find at least 1 job and send me an email with the link(s) to the job(s) you applied for. 

 

 

Here is the link for one job search site to get started. 

 

http://www.indeed.com 

 

Job criteria: 

 

You should find a computer engineering job. 

 

Must start after September 2016.

 

For now, just find one or more jobs you believe will work out well. We can talk about them further at our next meeting.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Davos

Davos,

 

After a little searching I found a security researcher positon at Intel.  It seems pretty promising, and really aligns with what I want to get into post-university.  The link to the job is here: http://jobs.intel.com/ShowJob/Id/814394/Security%20Researcher

 

Hopefully this one will pan out!  Thanks,

 

Charles

 

From: Stark, Davos 
Sent: Wednesday, October 12, 2016 4:26 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Job hunting

 

Hello Charles,

 

I know graduating is coming up soon for you. It would be good to do a preliminary job search. Please find at least 1 job and send me an email with the link(s) to the job(s) you applied for.

Greetings, traveler,

 

I hear you’re are interested in exploring Eastern Europe with our group. Recently the group is wondering whether or not it is safe to travel right now. We need to do some research and see what we can find out.

 

The plan is to land in Istanbul. Next, we will be traveling to Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.  After Sofia, the next step is some car travel to Macedonia and then onwards to Albania. Our last stop will be Tirana, in Albania.

 

The group would like to have some information sent to me to start this travel planning out:

 

A quick overview of each country’s political climate - I don’t want anyone getting into trouble and having this turn into some geopolitical affair! Is the country at war with a US ally? Is the country in political turmoil? Is there a US embassy? Is it safe to travel there now?

 

This will be a good start for the travel planning. Please research these items and send the information to me right away.

 

Kind regards,

Davos Stark

Eastern Reaches, an OSU Travel Group

Mr. Stark;

 

Istanbul is a little unstable right now.  It is safe to travel there but the recent terror attacks have put a lot of people on edge.  Diplomats advise that you should stay away from large gatherings, especially any that are political.

 

There is an embassy in Sofia, and is overall pretty safe.  You just need to look out for pickpocketing and shady ATM’s.  It should be pretty safe, and since it’s a part of the European Union you should be able to use Euros.

 

Macedonia looks safe, though there was some political unrest in 2014-2015.  Be sure to look out for political protest, and avoid them.  There is one embassy in Macedonia located in Skopje.

 

Finally, Tirana is pretty peaceful, but there is also frequent public demonstrations and constant risk of bombings similar to the ones earlier this year.  There’s a U.S. embassy in Tirana, but be sure never to travel to Lazarat, as it is a very dangerous place.

 

These places all look all right, but we’ll just have to watch out for political protests and the like.  Hopefully we can start planning more indepth parts of the trip.

 

Charles
